{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Officer",
  "description": "Khome Global Logistics Nigeria Limited is a top class freight forwarding relocation and logistics solution company that was established to positively contribute to the development of logistics sector of the Nigeria economy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are looking for an astute procurement officer to oversee purchasing activities and ensure that purchased items are both cost-efficient and of high quality.
	The procurement officer&#39;s responsibilities include supervising staff, maintaining positive supplier relations, evaluating supply options, approving purchases, and maintaining accurate records.
	To be successful as a procurement officer you should have an analytical mind and keep up with product and service trends.
	Ultimately, a top procurement officer should be able to negotiate well and ensure that all purchases comply with company standards.


Responsibilities


	Overseeing and supervising employees and all activities of the purchasing department.
	Preparing plans for the purchase of equipment, services, and supplies.
	Following and enforcing the company&#39;s procurement policies and procedures.
	Reviewing, comparing, analyzing, and approving products and services to be purchased.
	Managing inventories and maintaining accurate purchase and pricing records.
	Maintaining and updating supplier information such as qualifications, delivery times, product ranges, etc.
	Maintaining good supplier relations and negotiating contracts.
	Researching and evaluating prospective suppliers.
	Preparing budgets, cost analyses, and reports.


Requirements


	High school diploma/GED.
	2+ years of experience as a procurement officer or in a similar position.
	Degree in accounting, business management or a similar field preferred.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and purchasing software.
	Strong communication and negotiation skills.
	Good analytical and strategic thinking skills.
	Supervisory and management experience.
	Attention to detail.


Salary
N80,000 - N120,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;Khomeloglimited@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-05",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Khome Global Logistics Nigeria Limited"
    
  },

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "@type": "PropertyValue",

    "value": "189071"
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

Procurement Officer Job at Khome Global Logistics Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Khome Global Logistics Nigeria Limited is a top class freight forwarding relocation and logistics solution company that was established to positively contribute to the development of logistics sector of the Nigeria economy.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for an astute procurement officer to oversee purchasing activities and ensure that purchased items are both cost-efficient and of high quality.
	The procurement officer's responsibilities include supervising staff, maintaining positive supplier relations, evaluating supply options, approving purchases, and maintaining accurate records.
	To be successful as a procurement officer you should have an analytical mind and keep up with product and service trends.
	Ultimately, a top procurement officer should be able to negotiate well and ensure that all purchases comply with company standards.


Responsibilities


	Overseeing and supervising employees and all activities of the purchasing department.
	Preparing plans for the purchase of equipment, services, and supplies.
	Following and enforcing the company's procurement policies and procedures.
	Reviewing, comparing, analyzing, and approving products and services to be purchased.
	Managing inventories and maintaining accurate purchase and pricing records.
	Maintaining and updating supplier information such as qualifications, delivery times, product ranges, etc.
	Maintaining good supplier relations and negotiating contracts.
	Researching and evaluating prospective suppliers.
	Preparing budgets, cost analyses, and reports.


Requirements


	High school diploma/GED.
	2+ years of experience as a procurement officer or in a similar position.
	Degree in accounting, business management or a similar field preferred.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and purchasing software.
	Strong communication and negotiation skills.
	Good analytical and strategic thinking skills.
	Supervisory and management experience.
	Attention to detail.


Salary
N80,000 - N120,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Khomeloglimited@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Operations Assistant",
  "description": "EHA Clinics, a subsidiary of eHealth Africa, is a health care network operating across Nigeria that provides high-quality, innovative, data-driven, and technology-enabled services. EHA Clinics delivers a comprehensive range of state of the art health care services in each location, e.g,&nbsp; general consultations, laboratory investigations, pharmaceuticals, annual medical checks, child wellness checks, ultrasonography, and specialized services (urgent care, telemedicine, home care, dental care, and ophthalmology).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Operations Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Department:&nbsp;Operations
Reports to:&nbsp;Clinical Operations Manager

Mission Objective


	Clinical services operations department is responsible for the smooth running of the clinics, by providing support to the medical team to ensure the delivery of quality healthcare.
	The operations assistant manages appointment schedules for both the patient and doctor ensuring that patient wait times are kept at the minimum.
	They also provide information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiries as well as handling patient billing.


Duties and Responsibilities
Basic Transactions Process:
Purpose:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;


	Attends to patients at the clinic, triaging and classifying patients for optimal care create, update, and maintain low-level records and databases related to Odoo, EHA Care etc
	Ensuring the smooth running of the clinical operation in the clinics thereby encouraging a high patient flow and adherence to schedules.&nbsp;
	Sales of clinical products such as membership packages e.t.c
	Scheduling appointments and keeping track of patient wait time, Initiate prompt communication and reminders with patients on appointments through SMS, phone calls, emails etc


Inform:
Engagement:


	Providing information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiry.&nbsp;
	Acts as liaison person between the patient and other departments. Resolving queries and requests from the patients to the laboratory, medical and pharmacy teams.
	Act as liaison officers between HMO clients and EHA Clinics; confirming patient eligibility, seeking approvals, pre-authorizations and service coverage enquiries from the HMOs.


Basic Information Organization:
Delivery:


	Patient billing management- receipt of payments from clients and HMOs via various payment methods not limited to cash payments, bank transfers, POS e.t.c&nbsp;
	Supports managers and employees through a variety of tasks related to organization and communication
	Accomplishing organizational goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.


Targeted Specialized Knowledge


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Office Management &amp; Technology, Public Administration, Secretarial Studies, or any management-related field.
	Minimum of one year experience handling roles as a Personal Assistant, Front Desk Executive, and Customer Service in any reputable company.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-20",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-21",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "EHA Clinics"
    
  },

    }
  }
}



Operations Assistant Job at EHA Clinics




        
    

        
        EHA Clinics, a subsidiary of eHealth Africa, is a health care network operating across Nigeria that provides high-quality, innovative, data-driven, and technology-enabled services. EHA Clinics delivers a comprehensive range of state of the art health care services in each location, e.g,  general consultations, laboratory investigations, pharmaceuticals, annual medical checks, child wellness checks, ultrasonography, and specialized services (urgent care, telemedicine, home care, dental care, and ophthalmology).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Assistant

Job Location: Abuja
Department: Operations
Reports to: Clinical Operations Manager
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Mission Objective


	Clinical services operations department is responsible for the smooth running of the clinics, by providing support to the medical team to ensure the delivery of quality healthcare.
	The operations assistant manages appointment schedules for both the patient and doctor ensuring that patient wait times are kept at the minimum.
	They also provide information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiries as well as handling patient billing.


Duties and Responsibilities
Basic Transactions Process:
Purpose:    


	Attends to patients at the clinic, triaging and classifying patients for optimal care create, update, and maintain low-level records and databases related to Odoo, EHA Care etc
	Ensuring the smooth running of the clinical operation in the clinics thereby encouraging a high patient flow and adherence to schedules. 
	Sales of clinical products such as membership packages e.t.c
	Scheduling appointments and keeping track of patient wait time, Initiate prompt communication and reminders with patients on appointments through SMS, phone calls, emails etc


Inform:
Engagement:


	Providing information about the services and products of the Clinics when visitors make an enquiry. 
	Acts as liaison person between the patient and other departments. Resolving queries and requests from the patients to the laboratory, medical and pharmacy teams.
	Act as liaison officers between HMO clients and EHA Clinics; confirming patient eligibility, seeking approvals, pre-authorizations and service coverage enquiries from the HMOs.


Basic Information Organization:
Delivery:


	Patient billing management- receipt of payments from clients and HMOs via various payment methods not limited to cash payments, bank transfers, POS e.t.c 
	Supports managers and employees through a variety of tasks related to organization and communication
	Accomplishing organizational goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.


Targeted Specialized Knowledge


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Office Management & Technology, Public Administration, Secretarial Studies, or any management-related field.
	Minimum of one year experience handling roles as a Personal Assistant, Front Desk Executive, and Customer Service in any reputable company.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

Fly Country Wide Travel and Services Ltd is committed to remaining well positioned and equipped to support our clients in their travel deals at guaranteed lowest rates. In order to guarantee our client&rsquo;s efficiency and high performance on jobs, Fly Country Wide Travel and Services Ltd has skilled, resourceful, goal-oriented, and team players. With a passion for exploring the world and connecting people, we ensure every journey is seamless, memorable, and tailored to our client&rsquo;s needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer / Travel Consultant

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are excited to welcome a dynamic Travel Consultant (Sales Executive) to our esteemed team at Fly Countrywide Travel &amp; Services Ltd.
	As a Travel Consultant, you will play a crucial role in advising clients on travel options, creating customized travel itineraries, and ensuring seamless travel experiences.
	If you have a passion for travel, excellent sales skills, and a deep understanding of the travel industry, we invite you to join us in making travel dreams come true.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement effective sales strategies to drive business growth and achieve sales targets.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities through networking, referrals, and cold calling.
	Conduct market research to understand customer needs, preferences, and trends in the travel industry.
	Provide exceptional customer service by advising clients on travel options, including destinations, travel dates, costs, and accommodations, to meet their travel needs and preferences.
	Create customized travel itineraries, including flight bookings, hotel reservations, and travel insurance, ensuring a seamless travel experience.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of travel industry trends, visa regulations, and destination information to provide accurate and relevant advice to clients.
	Collaborate with internal teams to deliver personalized travel services and solutions.
	Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, ensuring repeat business and referrals.
	Handle client inquiries and complaints in a professional and timely manner, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction.
	Prepare and deliver presentations and sales pitches to potential clients and partners.
	Track and analyze sales performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions.
	Stay abreast of the latest travel industry developments, technological advancements, and marketing trends to drive innovation and uphold our competitive edge.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND, HND qualification or&nbsp;Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 0 - 5 years of&nbsp; relevant work experience.


Salary
N50,000 - N70,000 monthly.

Front Desk Officer / Travel Consultant Job at Fly Countrywide Travel & Services Limited




        
    

        
        
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

Fly Countrywide Travel & Services Limited is a leading travel, Tourism Agency company committed to delivering world-class travel solutions with a personal touch. Based in Ibadan, Oyo State, we specialize in domestic and international travel arrangements, tour packages, corporate travel management, visa processing, and concierge services.

Fly Country Wide Travel and Services Ltd is committed to remaining well positioned and equipped to support our clients in their travel deals at guaranteed lowest rates. In order to guarantee our client’s efficiency and high performance on jobs, Fly Country Wide Travel and Services Ltd has skilled, resourceful, goal-oriented, and team players. With a passion for exploring the world and connecting people, we ensure every journey is seamless, memorable, and tailored to our client’s needs.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk Officer / Travel Consultant

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are excited to welcome a dynamic Travel Consultant (Sales Executive) to our esteemed team at Fly Countrywide Travel & Services Ltd.
	As a Travel Consultant, you will play a crucial role in advising clients on travel options, creating customized travel itineraries, and ensuring seamless travel experiences.
	If you have a passion for travel, excellent sales skills, and a deep understanding of the travel industry, we invite you to join us in making travel dreams come true.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement effective sales strategies to drive business growth and achieve sales targets.
	Identify and pursue new business opportunities through networking, referrals, and cold calling.
	Conduct market research to understand customer needs, preferences, and trends in the travel industry.
	Provide exceptional customer service by advising clients on travel options, including destinations, travel dates, costs, and accommodations, to meet their travel needs and preferences.
	Create customized travel itineraries, including flight bookings, hotel reservations, and travel insurance, ensuring a seamless travel experience.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of travel industry trends, visa regulations, and destination information to provide accurate and relevant advice to clients.
	Collaborate with internal teams to deliver personalized travel services and solutions.
	Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, ensuring repeat business and referrals.
	Handle client inquiries and complaints in a professional and timely manner, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction.
	Prepare and deliver presentations and sales pitches to potential clients and partners.
	Track and analyze sales performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions.
	Stay abreast of the latest travel industry developments, technological advancements, and marketing trends to drive innovation and uphold our competitive edge.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an OND, HND qualification or Bachelor's Degree with 0 - 5 years of  relevant work experience.


Salary
N50,000 - N70,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and full clear Picture to: adminservices@flycountrywidetravelandservicesltd.com using the Job Position as the subject of the    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Representative",
  "description": "HRHub.ng Limited is a Human Resource Development &amp; Management Consulting practice firm located in Lagos. Since its founding, HRHub.ng Ltd has grown to become a leader in the provision of high value human resources, business advisory as well as learning &amp; development solutions to multinationals, local corporate organizations, governments and multilateral organizations. Our depth of our expertise, defined by carefully selected pool of multi-disciplinary consultants, ensures that we continue to be the firm of choice to our growing list of discerning clienteles.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking proactive and results-driven Sales Representatives to promote and sell our range of real estate offerings (houses and land) to new and existing clients.
	The ideal candidates will have strong communication skills, a professional appearance, and a passion for achieving sales targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote and sell properties to both new and existing customers
	Build and maintain strong client relationships
	Identify sales leads and convert them into successful deals
	Meet or exceed assigned sales targets
	Provide excellent customer service and follow-up
	Represent the brand professionally at all times
	Occasionally travel to client sites and property locations.


Requirements


	Minimum of a university degree
	Prior experience in real estate sales is an added advantage
	Strong verbal and written communication skills
	Ability to drive (a valid driver&rsquo;s license is an added advantage)
	Good dress sense and professional appearance
	Hardworking, loyal, and result-oriented
	Self-driven and highly motivated
	Reside in close proximity to the office (Lekki axis preferred)


Salary
N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their&nbsp;CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;recruitment@hrhub.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Sales Representative Job at HR Hub Nigeria




        
    

        
        HRHub.ng Limited is a Human Resource Development & Management Consulting practice firm located in Lagos. Since its founding, HRHub.ng Ltd has grown to become a leader in the provision of high value human resources, business advisory as well as learning & development solutions to multinationals, local corporate organizations, governments and multilateral organizations. Our depth of our expertise, defined by carefully selected pool of multi-disciplinary consultants, ensures that we continue to be the firm of choice to our growing list of discerning clienteles.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	We are seeking proactive and results-driven Sales Representatives to promote and sell our range of real estate offerings (houses and land) to new and existing clients.
	The ideal candidates will have strong communication skills, a professional appearance, and a passion for achieving sales targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote and sell properties to both new and existing customers
	Build and maintain strong client relationships
	Identify sales leads and convert them into successful deals
	Meet or exceed assigned sales targets
	Provide excellent customer service and follow-up
	Represent the brand professionally at all times
	Occasionally travel to client sites and property locations.


Requirements


	Minimum of a university degree
	Prior experience in real estate sales is an added advantage
	Strong verbal and written communication skills
	Ability to drive (a valid driver’s license is an added advantage)
	Good dress sense and professional appearance
	Hardworking, loyal, and result-oriented
	Self-driven and highly motivated
	Reside in close proximity to the office (Lekki axis preferred)


Salary
N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@hrhub.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Core Operations Officer",
  "description": "At Strivo Labs, we are passionate about helping businesses scale with speed and precision. We specialise in providing end-to-end digital solutions, from custom design and MVP development to automation and content creation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Core Operations Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

About the Role


	We are seeking a highly competent and detail-oriented Core Operations Officer with proven hands-on expertise in LoanDisk platform operations.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for driving efficiency across our lending, savings, and HNI investment operations by ensuring smooth system migration, accurate reporting, and operational excellence within LoanDisk.
	This role requires a deep understanding of Portfolio at Risk (PAR), loan interest calculations, overdue management, and the ability to generate insightful reports that support compliance, decision-making, and business growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the migration of all legacy and ongoing transactions into the LoanDisk platform.
	Configure, manage, and optimize LoanDisk for lending, savings, and HNI investment operations.
	Develop and maintain operational and financial reports directly from LoanDisk, including PAR analysis, overdue accounts, interest accrual, and repayment schedules.
	Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all migrated and new transactions.
	Collaborate with product, finance, and tech teams to streamline workflows and integrations within LoanDisk.
	Monitor and analyze PAR, overdue accounts, and interest collections to support proactive portfolio management.
	Embed audit-ready processes and controls within LoanDisk for compliance and risk management.
	Train and support internal teams on effective LoanDisk usage, reporting, and best practices.
	Continuously improve LoanDisk-related processes to enhance efficiency, reporting quality, and customer experience.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Accounting, or related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience in operations within lending, savings, or fintech environments.
	Demonstrated expertise with the LoanDisk platform (configuration, reporting, optimization, troubleshooting).
	Proven experience with LoanDisk reporting &mdash; including PAR, overdue accounts, and interest management.
	Strong understanding of lending operations, savings products, and HNI/wealth management processes.
	Experience in system migration or implementation projects with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.
	Solid background in financial operations, reconciliation, and performance reporting.
	Knowledge of compliance, audit, and regulatory requirements in financial services.
	High proficiency in Excel, data analysis, and financial reporting tools.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, with the ability to influence and train cross-functional teams.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, a short note on why they are a good fit and their salary expectations to:&nbsp;hiring@strivolabs.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  },

Core Operations Officer Job at  Strivo Labs




        
    

        
        At Strivo Labs, we are passionate about helping businesses scale with speed and precision. We specialise in providing end-to-end digital solutions, from custom design and MVP development to automation and content creation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Core Operations Officer

Job Location: Lagos

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a highly competent and detail-oriented Core Operations Officer with proven hands-on expertise in LoanDisk platform operations.
	The successful candidate will be responsible for driving efficiency across our lending, savings, and HNI investment operations by ensuring smooth system migration, accurate reporting, and operational excellence within LoanDisk.
	This role requires a deep understanding of Portfolio at Risk (PAR), loan interest calculations, overdue management, and the ability to generate insightful reports that support compliance, decision-making, and business growth.


Key Responsibilities


	Lead the migration of all legacy and ongoing transactions into the LoanDisk platform.
	Configure, manage, and optimize LoanDisk for lending, savings, and HNI investment operations.
	Develop and maintain operational and financial reports directly from LoanDisk, including PAR analysis, overdue accounts, interest accrual, and repayment schedules.
	Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across all migrated and new transactions.
	Collaborate with product, finance, and tech teams to streamline workflows and integrations within LoanDisk.
	Monitor and analyze PAR, overdue accounts, and interest collections to support proactive portfolio management.
	Embed audit-ready processes and controls within LoanDisk for compliance and risk management.
	Train and support internal teams on effective LoanDisk usage, reporting, and best practices.
	Continuously improve LoanDisk-related processes to enhance efficiency, reporting quality, and customer experience.


Qualifications & Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Accounting, or related field.
	3–5 years of experience in operations within lending, savings, or fintech environments.
	Demonstrated expertise with the LoanDisk platform (configuration, reporting, optimization, troubleshooting).
	Proven experience with LoanDisk reporting — including PAR, overdue accounts, and interest management.
	Strong understanding of lending operations, savings products, and HNI/wealth management processes.
	Experience in system migration or implementation projects with a focus on data accuracy and integrity.
	Solid background in financial operations, reconciliation, and performance reporting.
	Knowledge of compliance, audit, and regulatory requirements in financial services.
	High proficiency in Excel, data analysis, and financial reporting tools.
	Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, with the ability to influence and train cross-functional teams.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, a short note on why they are a good fit and their salary expectations to: hiring@strivolabs.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
